CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two POWERED BY thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO negative two POWERED BY thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND character at position index OF s EQUALS a single whitespace character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (character at position index OF s EQUALS the plus sign OR character at position index OF s EQUALS the minus sign)  
            IF character at position index OF s EQUALS the minus sign  
                SET sign TO negative one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND character at position index OF s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF character at position index OF s  
            IF result GREATER THAN (INT_MAX MINUS digit) DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n IS 0 THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        ASSIGN resultList TO grayCode(n - 1)  
        LET bitFlag BE 2 ^ (n - 1) * 1  
        
        DEFINE FUNCTION reverseList(inputList)  
            IF inputList IS EMPTY THEN  
                RETURN []  
            ELSE  
                RETURN reverseList(inputList[1:]) + [inputList[0]]  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET reversedResult BE reverseList(resultList)  
        LET extendedList BE []  
        
        FOR each element IN reversedResult DO  
            extendedList = extendedList + [(element BITWISE_OR bitFlag)]  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN resultList + extendedList  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero  
            RETURN a list containing zero  
        END IF  
        SET prev_gray TO the result of calling grayCode with the value of n MINUS one  
        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)
        INITIALIZE holder WITH an empty list
        SET pos TO 0
        WHILE pos IS LESS THAN LENGTH OF tokens
            SET current TO tokens[pos]
            IF current IN { "+", "-", "*", "/" }
                ASSIGN second TO holder REMOVE LAST ELEMENT
                ASSIGN first TO holder REMOVE LAST ELEMENT
                SWITCH current
                    CASE "+"
                        ADD (first + second) TO holder
                    CASE "-"
                        ADD (first - second) TO holder
                    CASE "*"
                        ADD (first * second) TO holder
                    CASE "/"
                        ASSIGN divisionResult TO first / second
                        IF divisionResult LESS THAN 0 AND divisionResult IS NOT AN INTEGER
                            ADD INTEGER PART OF divisionResult + 1 TO holder
                        ELSE
                            ADD INTEGER PART OF divisionResult TO holder
                        END IF
                END SWITCH
            ELSE
                CONVERT current TO INTEGER AND ADD TO holder
            END IF
            INCREMENT pos BY 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN holder[0]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)  
        SET stack TO an empty list  
        FOR each token IN tokens  
            IF token EQUALS one of the symbols plus MINUS MULTIPLY DIVIDE  
                SET b TO the last element removed from stack  
                SET a TO the last element removed from stack  
                IF token EQUALS plus  
                    APPEND a PLUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS minus  
                    APPEND a MINUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS multiply  
                    APPEND a MULTIPLIED BY b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS divide  
                    APPEND the integer value of a DIVIDED BY b TO stack  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                APPEND the integer value of token TO stack  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position zero of stack  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION reverseWords(s)  
        DECLARE wordList AS list  
        wordList ← EMPTY LIST  
        DECLARE index AS INTEGER  
        index ← 0  
        WHILE index < LENGTH(s) DO  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(s) AND s[index] = ' ' DO  
                index ← index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            IF index = LENGTH(s) THEN  
                BREAK  
            END IF  
            DECLARE startPos AS INTEGER  
            startPos ← index  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(s) AND s[index] ≠ ' ' DO  
                index ← index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET word TO SUBSTRING(s, startPos, index - startPos)  
            APPEND word TO wordList  
        END WHILE  
        DECLARE reversedList AS list  
        reversedList ← EMPTY LIST  
        DECLARE pos AS INTEGER  
        pos ← LENGTH(wordList) - 1  
        WHILE pos ≥ 0 DO  
            APPEND wordList[pos] TO reversedList  
            pos ← pos - 1  
        END WHILE  
        DECLARE result AS STRING  
        result ← ""  
        FOR EACH element IN reversedList DO  
            IF result = "" THEN  
                result ← element  
            ELSE  
                result ← result + " " + element  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n
        PROCEDURE markNonPrimes WITH PARAMETERS arr, current, endLimit
            IF current GREATER THAN endLimit THEN
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF arr[current] EQUALS True THEN
                SET factor TO current
                SET composite TO factor MULTIPLIED BY factor
                WHILE composite LESS THAN n DO
                    SET arr[composite] TO False
                    SET composite TO composite PLUS factor
                END WHILE
            END IF
            CALL markNonPrimes WITH arr, current PLUS 1, endLimit
        END PROCEDURE

        IF n LESS OR EQUAL 2 THEN
            RETURN 0
        END IF

        SET primeFlags TO empty list
        SET counter TO 0
        WHILE counter LESS THAN n DO
            ADD True TO primeFlags
            SET counter TO counter PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        SET primeFlags[0] TO False
        SET primeFlags[1] TO False

        SET boundary TO FLOOR(SQRT(n))

        CALL markNonPrimes WITH primeFlags, 2, boundary

        SET totalPrimes TO 0
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH(primeFlags) DO
            IF primeFlags[idx] IS True THEN
                SET totalPrimes TO totalPrimes PLUS 1
            END IF
            SET idx TO idx PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN totalPrimes
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)
        DECLARE FUNCTION fillDP(index, dpArray, squareList) RETURNS VOID
            IF index GREATER THAN n
                RETURN
            END IF
            DECLARE pos TO 0
            WHILE pos LESS THAN LENGTH(squareList)
                DECLARE currentSquare TO squareList[pos]
                IF index LESS THAN currentSquare
                    BREAK
                END IF
                IF dpArray[index] GREATER THAN dpArray[index - currentSquare] PLUS 1
                    SET dpArray[index] TO dpArray[index - currentSquare] PLUS 1
                END IF
                INCREMENT pos BY 1
            END WHILE
            CALL fillDP(index PLUS 1, dpArray, squareList)
        END FUNCTION

        DECLARE squareNums TO empty list
        DECLARE count TO 1
        WHILE count * count <= n
            APPEND count * count TO squareNums
            SET count TO count PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE dp TO list of size (n + 1) FILLED WITH infinity
        SET dp[0] TO 0

        CALL fillDP(1, dp, squareNums)

        RETURN dp[n]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        SET dp TO a list of size n PLUS one FILLED WITH infinite value  
        SET the element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        SET squares TO an empty list  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        FOR i FROM one TO n  
            FOR each square IN squares  
                IF i IS LESS THAN square  
                    BREAK the inner loop  
                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        SET sets_collection TO empty list
        SET index_outer TO 0
        WHILE index_outer LESS THAN LENGTH(words)
            SET current_word TO words[index_outer]
            SET char_set TO empty set
            SET pos_char TO 0
            WHILE pos_char LESS THAN LENGTH(current_word)
                ADD current_word[pos_char] TO char_set
                SET pos_char TO pos_char PLUS 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND char_set TO sets_collection
            SET index_outer TO index_outer PLUS 1
        END WHILE

        SET max_area TO 0

        FUNCTION check_pairs(i, j)
            IF i GREATER OR EQUAL LENGTH(words)
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF j GREATER OR EQUAL LENGTH(words)
                CALL check_pairs(i PLUS 1, i PLUS 2)
                RETURN
            END IF

            SET set_i TO sets_collection[i]
            SET set_j TO sets_collection[j]

            SET intersect_found TO FALSE
            SET iter_i TO 0
            SET elements_i TO LIST(set_i)
            WHILE iter_i LESS THAN LENGTH(elements_i) AND NOT intersect_found
                SET iter_j TO 0
                SET elements_j TO LIST(set_j)
                WHILE iter_j LESS THAN LENGTH(elements_j) AND NOT intersect_found
                    IF elements_i[iter_i] EQUALS elements_j[iter_j]
                        SET intersect_found TO TRUE
                    END IF
                    SET iter_j TO iter_j PLUS 1
                END WHILE
                SET iter_i TO iter_i PLUS 1
            END WHILE

            IF intersect_found EQUALS FALSE
                SET length_product TO LENGTH(words[i]) MULTIPLIED BY LENGTH(words[j])
                IF length_product GREATER THAN max_area
                    SET max_area TO length_product
                END IF
            END IF

            CALL check_pairs(i, j PLUS 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL check_pairs(0, 1)

        RETURN max_area
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)
        ASSIGN amount + 1 TO alpha
        CREATE dp WITH alpha ELEMENTS ALL INITIALIZED TO alpha
        ASSIGN 0 TO dp[0]

        FUNCTION recurBeta(index)
            IF index > amount THEN RETURN END IF

            SET cursor TO 0
            WHILE cursor < LENGTH(coins)
                LET delta = index - coins[cursor]
                IF delta >= 0 THEN
                    LET candidate = dp[delta] + 1
                    IF candidate < dp[index] THEN
                        dp[index] = candidate
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT cursor
            END WHILE

            CALL recurBeta(index + 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL recurBeta(1)

        IF dp[amount] != alpha THEN
            RETURN dp[amount]
        END IF

        RETURN -1
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s
        INITIALIZE tally AS empty map
        FOR each symbol IN s
            IF symbol NOT IN tally THEN
                SET tally[symbol] AS 1
            ELSE
                SET currentCount AS tally[symbol]
                SET increasedCount AS currentCount + 1
                SET tally[symbol] AS increasedCount
            END IF
        END FOR

        INITIALIZE rankingArray AS empty list
        FOR each keyValuePair IN tally
            ADD keyValuePair TO rankingArray
        END FOR

        SET indexCounter AS 0
        WHILE indexCounter < LENGTH(rankingArray)
            SET pivotIndex AS indexCounter
            SET compareIndex AS indexCounter + 1
            WHILE compareIndex < LENGTH(rankingArray)
                IF rankingArray[compareIndex].value > rankingArray[pivotIndex].value THEN
                    SET pivotIndex AS compareIndex
                END IF
                ADD 1 TO compareIndex
            END WHILE
            IF pivotIndex != indexCounter THEN
                SET temporary AS rankingArray[indexCounter]
                SET rankingArray[indexCounter] AS rankingArray[pivotIndex]
                SET rankingArray[pivotIndex] AS temporary
            END IF
            ADD 1 TO indexCounter
        END WHILE

        INITIALIZE outputString AS empty string
        SET pointer AS 0
        WHILE pointer < LENGTH(rankingArray)
            SET currentEntry AS rankingArray[pointer]
            SET charVal AS currentEntry.key
            SET repeatTimes AS currentEntry.value
            SET repeatedSegment AS EMPTY STRING
            SET counterVar AS 0
            WHILE counterVar < repeatTimes
                SET repeatedSegment AS repeatedSegment + charVal
                ADD 1 TO counterVar
            END WHILE
            SET outputString AS outputString + repeatedSegment
            ADD 1 TO pointer
        END WHILE

        OUTPUT outputString
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE participantList AS an empty list  
        FUNCTION initializeTeams(current)  
            IF current GREATER THAN n THEN  
                RETURN  
            ELSE  
                APPEND string representation of current TO participantList  
                CALL initializeTeams(current + 1)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        CALL initializeTeams(1)  
        
        FUNCTION pairUp(count)  
            IF count EQUALS 1 THEN  
                RETURN  
            ELSE  
                FOR index FROM 0 TO (count DIV 2) - 1  
                    DECLARE leftTeam AS participantList[index]  
                    DECLARE rightTeam AS participantList[count - 1 - index]  
                    SET participantList[index] TO "(" + leftTeam + "," + rightTeam + ")"  
                END FOR  
                CALL pairUp(count DIV 2)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        CALL pairUp(n)  
        RETURN participantList[0]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET left TO zero  
        SET right TO integer VALUE OF the SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        WHILE left LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO right holds  
            SET current_sum TO left MULTIPLIED BY left PLUS right MULTIPLIED BY right  
            IF current_sum EQUALS c THEN  
                RETURN true  
            ELSE IF current_sum LESS THAN c THEN  
                INCREMENT left BY one  
            ELSE  
                DECREMENT right BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN false  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)  
        DECLARE radiantQueue AS new deque  
        DECLARE direQueue AS new deque  
        DECLARE pos AS INTEGER  
        DECLARE senator AS CHARACTER  

        pos ← 0  
        REPEAT UNTIL pos EQUALS LENGTH(senate)  
            senator ← senate[pos]  
            SWITCH senator  
                CASE 'R':  
                    radiantQueue.ADD_TO_BACK(pos)  
                CASE 'D':  
                    direQueue.ADD_TO_BACK(pos)  
            END SWITCH  
            pos ← pos PLUS 1  
        END REPEAT  

        FUNCTION battle(rList, dList, lenSenate)  
            RETURN FUNCTION ()  
                IF rList.IS_EMPTY() OR dList.IS_EMPTY() THEN  
                    RETURN  
                END IF  
                DECLARE rPos AS INTEGER ← rList.REMOVE_FRONT()  
                DECLARE dPos AS INTEGER ← dList.REMOVE_FRONT()  
                IF NOT (rPos GREATER_OR_EQUAL dPos) THEN  
                    rList.ADD_TO_BACK(rPos PLUS lenSenate)

                    dList.ADD_TO_BACK(dPos PLUS lenSenate)  
                END IF  
                CALL battle(rList, dList, lenSenate)()  
            END FUNCTION  
        END FUNCTION  

        CALL battle(radiantQueue, direQueue, LENGTH(senate))()  

        IF radiantQueue.IS_EMPTY() THEN  
            RETURN "Dire"  
        ELSE  
            RETURN "Radiant"  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)  
        ASSIGN reference TO new double-ended queue named radiant  
        ASSIGN reference TO new double-ended queue named dire  

        FOR each index i AND character s IN senate  
            IF character s EQUALS the character representing Radiant party  
                APPEND index i TO radiant  
            ELSE  
                APPEND index i TO dire  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        WHILE radiant is not empty AND dire is not empty  
            REMOVE and ASSIGN the first element from radiant TO r_index  
            REMOVE and ASSIGN the first element from dire TO d_index  

            IF r_index LESS THAN d_index  
                APPEND r_index PLUS the length of senate TO radiant  
            ELSE  
                APPEND d_index PLUS the length of senate TO dire  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  

        IF radiant is not empty  
            RETURN the word Radiant  
        ELSE  
            RETURN the word Dire  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)
        DEFINE length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1
        DEFINE length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2

        DEFINE matrix dp WITH size [length_s1 + 1][length_s2 + 1], FILLED WITH 0

        INDEX j := 0
        WHILE j < length_s2
            LET dp[0][j + 1] BE dp[0][j] + ASCII_CODE OF s2[j]
            j := j + 1
        END WHILE

        INDEX i := 0
        WHILE i < length_s1
            LET dp[i + 1][0] BE dp[i][0] + ASCII_CODE OF s1[i]
            i := i + 1
        END WHILE

        PROCEDURE fill_matrix(i, j)
            IF i > length_s1 THEN RETURN
            IF j > length_s2 THEN
                fill_matrix(i + 1, 1)
                RETURN
            END IF

            IF s1[i - 1] EQUALS s2[j - 1] THEN
                LET dp[i][j] BE dp[i - 1][j - 1]
            ELSE
                LET left_option BE dp[i - 1][j] + ASCII_CODE OF s1[i - 1]
                LET top_option BE dp[i][j - 1] + ASCII_CODE OF s2[j - 1]
                LET dp[i][j] BE MINIMUM OF left_option, top_option
            END IF

            fill_matrix(i, j + 1)
        END PROCEDURE

        fill_matrix(1, 1)

        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF s1  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s2

            END FOR  
        END FOR

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        LET size BE LENGTH OF graph  
        LET marks BE a dictionary WITH KEYS FROM 0 TO size - 1 INITIALIZED TO 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfsCheck(vertex, mark)  
            marks[vertex] = mark  
            LET neighbors BE graph[vertex]  
            
            FOR index FROM LENGTH OF neighbors - 1 DOWNTO 0  
                LET adjacent BE neighbors[index]  
                
                SWITCH marks[adjacent]  
                    CASE mark:  
                        RETURN False  
                    CASE 0:  
                        LET result BE dfsCheck(adjacent, -mark)  
                        IF result == False THEN  
                            RETURN False  
                        END IF  
                END SWITCH  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET pos BE 0  
        WHILE pos < size  
            IF marks[pos] == 0 THEN  
                IF NOT dfsCheck(pos, 1) THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            pos = pos + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numTilings(n)
        CONSTANT P = 10^9 + 7

        CREATE dp_array AS array indexed 0 TO n WITH default 0
        DECLARE dp1_map AS map from integer TO integer
        ASSIGN dp_array[0] TO 1
        ASSIGN dp_array[1] TO 1

        IF n ≥ 2 THEN
            ASSIGN dp_array[2] TO 2
            SET dp1_map[2] TO 1
        END IF

        DEFINE PROCEDURE iterateFrom(k)
            IF k > n THEN RETURN
            LET val1 = dp_array[k-1]
            LET val2 = dp_array[k-2]
            LET val3 = dp1_map[k-1]
            LET new_dp = ((val1 + val2) + 2 * val3) MOD P
            LET new_dp1 = (dp_array[k-2] + dp1_map[k-1]) MOD P
            ASSIGN dp_array[k] TO new_dp
            SET dp1_map[k] TO new_dp1
            CALL iterateFrom(k + 1)
        END PROCEDURE

        CALL iterateFrom(3)

        RETURN dp_array[n]

    FUNCTION numTilings(n)

        SET dp TO a list of zeros with LENGTH n PLUS one

            SET element at position two of dp TO two  
            SET element at position two of dp1 TO one  
        END IF

        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n of dp

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)  
        IF n GREATER THAN four thousand eight hundred THEN  
            RETURN one point zero  
        END IF  
        SET n TO n PLUS twenty four DIVIDED BY twenty five  
        SET memo TO empty dictionary  
        FUNCTION dp(a, b)  
            IF tuple of a AND b EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN value of tuple of a AND b IN memo  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point five  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN one point zero  
            END IF  
            IF b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN

            SET value of tuple of a AND b IN memo TO prob  
            RETURN prob  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dp of n AND n

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET same TO empty set  
        FOR each pair of front_card AND back_card IN fronts AND backs simultaneously  
            IF front_card EQUALS back_card  
                ADD front_card TO same  
            END IF  
        END FOR

            ADD number TO all_numbers

            ADD number TO all_numbers

            END IF

    FUNCTION carFleet(target, position, speed)  
        ASSIGN zipped_pairs TO an empty list  
        ASSIGN idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length of position  
            APPEND (position[idx], speed[idx]) TO zipped_pairs  
            INCREMENT idx BY 1

        ASSIGN j TO 0

            ASSIGN pos_val TO zipped_pairs[j][0]

            INCREMENT j BY 1

    FUNCTION carFleet(target position speed)  
        SET paired_list TO the list of elements obtained by pairing each element at each position in position WITH the element at the corresponding position in speed

        END FOR

        SET current_max_time TO zero

            IF time GREATER THAN current_max_time  
                INCREMENT fleets BY one  
                SET current_max_time TO time  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN fleets  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION superEggDrop(k, n)  
        DECLARE steps AS INTEGER  
        ASSIGN 0 TO steps  
        DECLARE results AS LIST OF INTEGER  
        ASSIGN ARRAY FILLED WITH 0, LENGTH k+1 TO results  
        
        FUNCTION recursiveLoop()  
            IF results[k] >= n THEN  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            
            steps = steps + 1  
            DECLARE iterator AS INTEGER  
            ASSIGN k TO iterator  
            
            WHILE iterator > 0 DO  
                results[iterator] = 1 + results[iterator - 1] + results[iterator]  
                iterator = iterator - 1  
            END WHILE  
            CALL recursiveLoop()  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        CALL recursiveLoop()  
        RETURN steps  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION gridIllumination(n, lamps, queries)
        DEFINE rows AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE columns AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE diagonals AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE anti_diagonals AS dictionary with default 0
        DEFINE active_lamps AS empty set

        SET index TO 0
        WHILE index < LENGTH(lamps)
            LET x = lamps[index][0]
            LET y = lamps[index][1]
            IF NOT (x, y) IN active_lamps THEN
                INSERT (x, y) INTO active_lamps
                rows[x] = rows[x] + 1
                columns[y] = columns[y] + 1
                diagonals[x - y] = diagonals[x - y] + 1
                anti_diagonals[x + y] = anti_diagonals[x + y] + 1
            END IF
            index = index + 1
        END WHILE

        SET movement_offsets TO [(-1,0),(-1,1),(0,-1),(0,0),(0,1),(1,-1),(1,0),(1,1)]

        LET output AS empty list

        FOR EACH query_point IN queries DO
            LET a = query_point[0]
            LET b = query_point[1]

            IF rows[a] <= 0 AND columns[b] <= 0 AND diagonals[a - b] <= 0 AND anti_diagonals[a + b] <= 0 THEN
                APPEND 0 TO output
            ELSE
                APPEND 1 TO output
            END IF

            FOR EACH offset IN movement_offsets DO
                LET new_x = a + offset[0]
                LET new_y = b + offset[1]
                IF (new_x, new_y) IN active_lamps THEN
                    REMOVE (new_x, new_y) FROM active_lamps
                    rows[new_x] = rows[new_x] - 1
                    columns[new_y] = columns[new_y] - 1
                    diagonals[new_x - new_y] = diagonals[new_x - new_y] - 1
                    anti_diagonals[new_x + new_y] = anti_diagonals[new_x + new_y] - 1
                END IF
            END FOR
        END FOR

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION gridIllumination(n, lamps, queries)  
        SET row_count TO an empty dictionary with default integer zero  
        SET col_count TO an empty dictionary with default integer zero  
        SET diag_count TO an empty dictionary with default integer zero  
        SET anti_diag_count TO an empty dictionary with default integer zero  
        SET lamp_positions TO an empty set  
        
        FOR each pair r c IN the elements of lamps  
            IF the tuple of r and c is not in lamp_positions  
                ADD the tuple of r and c TO lamp_positions  
                INCREMENT the value at key r in row_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key c in col_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key the subtraction of c from r in diag_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key the sum of r and c in anti_diag_count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        SET directions TO the list of pairs negative one negative one negative one zero negative one one zero negative one zero zero zero zero one one negative one one zero one one one  
        
        SET result TO an empty list  
        
        FOR each pair r c IN the elements of queries  
            IF the value at key r in row_count is greater than zero OR the value at key c in col_count is greater than zero OR the value at key the subtraction of c from r in diag_count is greater than zero OR the value at key the sum of r and c in anti_diag_count is greater than zero  
                APPEND one TO result  
            ELSE  
                APPEND zero TO result  
            END IF  
            
            FOR each pair dr dc IN directions  
                SET nr TO r PLUS dr  
                SET nc TO c PLUS dc

                    DECREMENT the value at key nr in row_count BY one  
                    DECREMENT the value at key nc in col_count BY one  
                    DECREMENT the value at key the subtraction of nc from nr in diag_count BY one  
                    DECREMENT the value at key the sum of nr and nc in anti_diag_count BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)
        SET lengthVal AS LENGTH(s)
        SET largestChar AS 'a'
        FOR alpha FROM 1 TO lengthVal
            IF s[alpha - 1] > largestChar THEN
                SET largestChar AS s[alpha - 1]
            END IF
        END FOR
        
        INITIALIZE indexCollection AS an empty queue
        SET numberTo AS 0
        WHILE numberTo < lengthVal
            IF s[numberTo] = largestChar THEN
                INSERT numberTo INTO indexCollection
            END IF
            ADD 1 TO numberTo
        END WHILE
        
        SET leadingString AS ""
        SET pointer AS 0
        WHILE pointer < SIZE(indexCollection)
            SET cursor AS DEQUEUE indexCollection
            SET candidate AS SUBSTR(s, cursor, lengthVal - cursor)
            IF NOT(candidate <= leadingString) THEN
                SET leadingString AS candidate
            END IF
            ADD 1 TO pointer
        END WHILE
        
        OUTPUT leadingString
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxValueAfterReverse(nums)  
        LET length = LENGTH OF nums  
        IF length EQUALS 2 THEN  
            RETURN ABS(nums[0] - nums[1])  
        END IF  
        
        LET total_diff = 0  
        LET index = 1  
        WHILE index < length  
            SET total_diff = total_diff + ABS(nums[index] - nums[index - 1])  
            SET index = index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET highest_edge_improvement = 0  
        FOR j IN RANGE(1, length) DO  
            LET gain_candidate = ABS(nums[0] - nums[j]) - ABS(nums[j] - nums[j - 1])  
            IF gain_candidate > highest_edge_improvement THEN  
                SET highest_edge_improvement = gain_candidate  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR k IN RANGE(0, length - 1) DO  
            LET alt_gain = ABS(nums[length - 1] - nums[k]) - ABS(nums[k + 1] - nums[k])  
            IF alt_gain > highest_edge_improvement THEN  
                SET highest_edge_improvement = alt_gain  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        LET minima_across_pairs = nums[0] + nums[1]  
        LET maxima_across_pairs = nums[0]  
        FOR m FROM 0 TO length - 2 DO  
            LET current_max = MAX(nums[m], nums[m+1])  
            LET current_min = MIN(nums[m], nums[m+1])  
            IF current_max < minima_across_pairs THEN  
                SET minima_across_pairs = current_max  
            END IF  
            IF current_min > maxima_across_pairs THEN  
                SET maxima_across_pairs = current_min  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        LET calculated_gain = MAX(0, 2 * (maxima_across_pairs - minima_across_pairs))  
        
        RETURN total_diff + MAX(highest_edge_improvement, calculated_gain)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION cherryPickup(grid)  
        SET rows TO LENGTH OF grid  
        SET cols TO LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX 0  
        
        FUNCTION dp(r, c1, c2)  
            IF c1 LESS THAN 0 OR c1 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols OR c2 LESS THAN 0 OR c2 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols THEN  
                RETURN 0  
            END IF  
            
            IF c1 EQUALS c2 THEN  
                SET cherries TO grid AT INDEX r AND c1  
            ELSE  
                SET cherries TO grid AT INDEX r AND c1 PLUS grid AT INDEX r AND c2  
            END IF

                RETURN cherries

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION cherryPickup(grid)  
        SET rows TO the LENGTH OF grid  
        SET cols TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        
        FUNCTION dp(r c1 c2)  
            IF c1 LESS THAN zero OR c1 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols OR c2 LESS THAN zero OR c2 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols THEN  
                RETURN zero  
            END IF  
            
            IF c1 EQUALS c2 THEN  
                SET cherries TO element at position r of grid element at position c1  
            ELSE  
                SET cherries TO element at position r of grid element at position c1 PLUS element at position r of grid element at position c2  
            END IF  
            
            IF r EQUALS rows MINUS one THEN  
                RETURN cherries  
            END IF  
            
            SET max_cherries TO zero  
            FOR each dc1 IN list containing negative one zero and one  
                FOR each dc2 IN list containing negative one zero and one  
                    SET possible TO dp(r PLUS one c1 PLUS dc1 c2 PLUS dc2)  
                    IF possible GREATER THAN max_cherries THEN  
                        SET max_cherries TO possible  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN cherries PLUS max_cherries  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dp(zero zero cols MINUS one)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDifference(nums AS List OF Integer) RETURNS Integer  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF nums DIVIDED BY two  
        SET total_sum TO the SUM OF all elements IN nums  
        SET target TO total_sum DIVIDED BY two  
        SET min_diff TO positive infinity  
          
        SET left_half TO the SUBLIST OF nums FROM the first element TO element at position n minus one  
        SET right_half TO the SUBLIST OF nums FROM element at position n TO the LAST element  
          
        SET left_sums TO a new LIST containing n PLUS one EMPTY MAPPINGS  
        SET right_sums TO a new LIST containing n PLUS one EMPTY MAPPINGS  
          
        FOR each integer i FROM zero TO n INCLUSIVE  
            FOR each combination combo OF size i TAKEN FROM left_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF all elements IN combo  
                IF subset_sum NOT IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums THEN  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums BY one  
            END FOR  
              
            FOR each combination combo OF size i TAKEN FROM right_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF all elements IN combo  
                IF subset_sum NOT IN the mapping at position i OF right_sums THEN  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF right_sums TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF right_sums BY one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
          
        FOR each integer i FROM zero TO n INCLUSIVE  
            SET left_values TO the SORTED LIST OF all keys IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums  
            SET right_values TO the SORTED LIST OF all keys IN the mapping at position n MINUS i OF right_sums

                IF candidate_diff LESS THAN zero THEN

                    DECREMENT k BY one  
                ELSE

                END IF  
            END WHILE  
        END FOR  
          
        RETURN min_diff  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxTotalFruits(fruits AS list of list of integers, startPos AS integer, k AS integer) RETURNS integer
        ASSIGN 0 TO peakAmount
        ASSIGN 0 TO accumulated
        ASSIGN 0 TO beginIndex

        SET endIndex TO 0
        WHILE endIndex IS LESS THAN LENGTH(fruits)
            LET currentPos BE fruits[endIndex][0]
            LET basketCount BE fruits[endIndex][1]
            ASSIGN accumulated PLUS basketCount TO accumulated

            LOOP INDEFINITE
                LET lowPos BE fruits[beginIndex][0]
                LET rightDistance BE ABS(currentPos - startPos)
                LET leftDistance BE ABS(lowPos - startPos)
                LET gap BETWEEN BE currentPos - lowPos

                LET distanceMetric BE MIN(rightDistance, leftDistance) + gap
                
                LET inLeftBound BE (startPos - k) <= lowPos AND lowPos <= (startPos + k)
                LET inRightBound BE (startPos - k) <= currentPos AND currentPos <= (startPos + k)
                LET condition VALID BE inLeftBound AND inRightBound AND distanceMetric <= k

                IF beginIndex > endIndex OR condition VALID THEN
                    BREAK OUT OF LOOP
                END IF

                ASSIGN accumulated - fruits[beginIndex][1] TO accumulated
                ASSIGN beginIndex + 1 TO beginIndex
            END LOOP

            IF peakAmount < accumulated THEN
                ASSIGN accumulated TO peakAmount
            END IF

            ASSIGN endIndex + 1 TO endIndex
        END WHILE

        RETURN peakAmount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumCost(n, highways, k)  
        CREATE adjacency_list AS a map with default empty list  
        FOR route IN highways  
            LET a = route[0]  
            LET b = route[1]  
            LET fee = route[2]  
            APPEND (b, fee) TO adjacency_list[a]  
            APPEND (a, fee) TO adjacency_list[b]  
        END FOR  

        SET best_value TO negative infinity  

        FUNCTION dfs(current_city, visited_nodes, current_sum, edges_count)  
            IF edges_count IS k THEN  
                IF current_sum > best_value THEN  
                    best_value = current_sum  
                END IF  
                RETURN  
            END IF  

            FOR EACH (next_city, toll_cost) IN adjacency_list[current_city]  
                IF next_city NOT IN visited_nodes THEN  
                    visited_nodes.ADD(next_city)  
                    CALL dfs(next_city, visited_nodes, current_sum + toll_cost, edges_count + 1)  
                    visited_nodes.REMOVE(next_city)  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR city_index FROM 0 TO n - 1 DO  
            SET visited_nodes TO new set containing city_index  
            CALL dfs(city_index, visited_nodes, 0, 0)  
        END FOR  

        RETURN best_value  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumCost(n, highways, k)  
        CREATE graph AS a default mapping FROM a key TO a list  
        FOR each city1 city2 toll IN highways  
            APPEND the pair of city2 and toll TO the list in graph at key city1  
            APPEND the pair of city1 and toll TO the list in graph at key city2  
        END FOR  
  
        FUNCTION dfs(city visited cost highways_used)  
            DECLARE max_cost AS nonlocal variable  
  
            IF highways_used EQUALS k THEN  
                SET max_cost TO the greater value BETWEEN max_cost AND cost  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
  
            FOR each neighbor toll IN the list at graph at key city  
                IF neighbor NOT IN visited THEN  
                    ADD neighbor TO visited  
                    CALL dfs WITH neighbor visited cost PLUS toll highways_used PLUS one  
                    REMOVE neighbor FROM visited  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
  
        SET max_cost TO negative one  
        FOR start_city FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET visited TO a set containing start_city  
            CALL dfs WITH start_city visited zero zero  
        END FOR  
  
        RETURN max_cost  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                        SET element at position i and j of fire_times TO zero  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR

                        SET element at position nx and ny of fire_times TO t PLUS one  
                        APPEND the tuple containing nx ny t PLUS one TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END WHILE

            SET visited TO a set containing the tuple zero zero  
            
            WHILE queue is not empty  
                REMOVE the first element from queue and unpack into x y t  
                FOR each pair dx dy IN directions

                                RETURN True  
                            ELSE  
                                RETURN False  
                            END IF  
                        END IF  
                        IF element at position nx and ny of fire_times IS GREATER THAN t PLUS one  
                            ADD the tuple nx ny TO visited

                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END WHILE

        IF result NOT EQUALS m MULTIPLIED BY n  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN one followed by nine zeros  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price list_of_integers special list_of_lists_of_integers needs list_of_integers) RETURNS integer  
        SET filtered_special TO an empty list  
        FOR each offer IN special  
            SET total_items_in_offer TO zero  
            FOR each item_index FROM the first position TO the position before the last position IN offer  
                INCREMENT total_items_in_offer BY element at position item_index of offer  
            END FOR  
            SET total_price_of_offer TO zero  
            FOR each item_index FROM the first position TO the position before the last position IN offer  
                SET offer_price TO element at position item_index of offer MULTIPLIED BY element at position item_index of price  
                INCREMENT total_price_of_offer BY offer_price  
            END FOR  
            IF total_items_in_offer GREATER THAN zero AND element at the last position of offer LESS THAN total_price_of_offer THEN  
                APPEND offer TO filtered_special  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET special TO filtered_special  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(needs_tuple tuple_of_integers) RETURNS integer  
            SET min_cost TO zero  
            FOR each index FROM the first position TO the last position IN needs_tuple  
                SET cost_for_this_index TO element at position index of price MULTIPLIED BY element at position index of needs_tuple  
                INCREMENT min_cost BY cost_for_this_index  
            END FOR  
            
            FOR each offer IN special  
                SET new_needs TO an empty list  
                FOR each index FROM the first position TO the position before the last position IN offer  
                    SET updated_need TO element at position index of needs_tuple MINUS element at position index of offer  
                    APPEND updated_need TO new_needs  
                END FOR  
                
                SET can_use_offer TO True  
                FOR each need_value IN new_needs  
                    IF need_value LESS THAN zero THEN  
                        SET can_use_offer TO False  
                        BREAK  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
                
                IF can_use_offer IS True THEN  
                    SET cost_with_offer TO element at the last position of offer PLUS dfs(tuple converted from new_needs)  
                    IF cost_with_offer LESS THAN min_cost THEN  
                        SET min_cost TO cost_with_offer  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN min_cost  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dfs(tuple converted from needs)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price, special, needs)  
        SET special TO an empty list  
        FOR each offer IN the original special list  
            IF the sum of elements at all positions except the last in offer IS GREATER THAN zero AND  
               the last element of offer IS LESS THAN the sum of the product of corresponding elements of price and offer except the last element  
                APPEND offer TO special  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(needs)  
            SET min_cost TO zero  
            FOR each element at position index FROM zero TO the length of price MINUS one  
                INCREMENT min_cost BY the element at position index of price MULTIPLIED BY the element at position index of needs  
            END FOR  
            
            FOR each offer IN special  
                SET new_needs TO an empty list  
                FOR each index FROM zero TO the length of needs MINUS one  
                    APPEND to new_needs the element at position index of needs MINUS the element at position index of offer  
                END FOR  
                
                SET can_use_offer TO true  
                FOR each element n IN new_needs  
                    IF n IS LESS THAN zero  
                        SET can_use_offer TO false  
                        BREAK the loop  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
                
                IF can_use_offer EQUALS true  
                    SET possible_cost TO the last element of offer PLUS dfs(the tuple version of new_needs)  
                    IF possible_cost IS LESS THAN min_cost  
                        SET min_cost TO possible_cost  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN min_cost  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dfs(the tuple version of needs)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF x LESS THAN zero OR x GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF grid OR y LESS THAN zero OR y GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid OR element at position x of grid AT position y EQUALS zero  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            SET element at position x of grid AT position y TO zero  
            APPEND the PAIR consisting of x AND y TO island  
            CALL dfs WITH x INCREMENTED BY one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x DECREMENTED BY one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y INCREMENTED BY one AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y DECREMENTED BY one AND island  
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            SET shapes TO an EMPTY list  
            FOR each PAIR dx AND dy IN the LIST of PAIRS consisting of one and one AND one and MINUS one AND MINUS one and one AND MINUS one and MINUS one  
                SET new_island TO an EMPTY list  
                FOR each PAIR x AND y IN island  
                    APPEND the PAIR consisting of x MULTIPLIED BY dx AND y MULTIPLIED BY dy TO new_island  
                END FOR  
                SORT new_island  
                SET min_x TO the MINIMUM x value IN new_island  
                SET min_y TO the MINIMUM y value IN new_island  
                APPEND to shapes the TUPLE of PAIRS where each PAIR consists of element x MINUS min_x AND element y MINUS min_y FOR each PAIR x AND y IN new_island  
            END FOR  
            SET length_of_shapes TO the LENGTH OF shapes  
            FOR i FROM zero TO length_of_shapes MINUS one  
                APPEND to shapes the TUPLE of PAIRS where each PAIR consists of element y AND MINUS element x FOR each PAIR x AND y IN element at position i of shapes  
            END FOR  
            RETURN the MINIMUM element in shapes  
        END FUNCTION

        SET islands TO an EMPTY set  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF grid MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid AT position j EQUALS one  
                    SET island TO an EMPTY list  
                    CALL dfs WITH i AND j AND island  
                    ADD the RESULT of normalize called with island TO islands  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the LENGTH OF islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numDistinctIslands2(grid)  
        FUNCTION dfs(x, y, island)  
            IF x LESS THAN zero OR x GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH OF grid OR y LESS THAN zero OR y GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid OR element at position x of grid at position y EQUALS zero  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            SET element at position x of grid at position y TO zero  
            APPEND tuple of x and y TO island  
            CALL dfs WITH x PLUS one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x MINUS one AND y AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y PLUS one AND island  
            CALL dfs WITH x AND y MINUS one AND island  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION normalize(island)  
            SET shapes TO empty list  
            FOR each pair dx and dy IN list of pairs of one and one PLUS one and minus one PLUS minus one and one PLUS minus one and minus one  
                SET new_island TO empty list  
                FOR each pair x and y IN island  
                    APPEND tuple of x MULTIPLIED BY dx AND y MULTIPLIED BY dy TO new_island  
                END FOR  
                SORT new_island in ascending order  
                SET min_x TO the minimum x among all pairs in new_island  
                SET min_y TO the minimum y among all pairs in new_island  
                APPEND tuple of pairs where each x MINUS min_x AND each y MINUS min_y from new_island TO shapes  
            END FOR  
            SET original_length TO LENGTH OF shapes  
            FOR index FROM zero TO original_length MINUS one  
                APPEND tuple of pairs where y AND negative x from shape at position index TO shapes  
            END FOR  
            RETURN the minimal element in shapes according to lexicographical order  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET islands TO empty set  
        FOR i FROM zero TO LENGTH OF grid MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid at position j EQUALS one  
                    SET island TO empty list  
                    CALL dfs WITH i AND j AND island  
                    ADD normalize of island TO islands  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN LENGTH OF islands  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findDerangement(n)  
        DEFINE modulus = 10^9 + 7  
        
        FUNCTION calc(k, val1, val2)  
            IF k > n THEN  
                RETURN val2  
            ELSE  
                SET temp = (k - 1) * (val1 + val2)  
                SET temp = temp MOD modulus  
                RETURN calc(k + 1, val2, temp)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        IF n == 1 THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        IF n == 2 THEN  
            RETURN 1  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN calc(3, 0, 1)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findDerangement(n)  
        SET MODULO TO ten RAISED TO THE POWER OF nine PLUS seven  
        
        IF n EQUALS one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        IF n EQUALS two  
            RETURN one  
        END IF  
        
        SET previous_twice TO one  
        SET previous_once TO zero  
        
        FOR integer i FROM three TO n  
            SET current_value TO integer i MINUS one MULTIPLIED BY the SUM OF previous_once AND previous_twice  
            SET current_value TO current_value MODULO MODULO  
            SET previous_twice TO previous_once  
            SET previous_once TO current_value  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN previous_once  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
